com.nullwire.trace
Class HttpPostStackInfoSender

java.lang.Object
  com.nullwire.trace.HttpPostStackInfoSender
All Implemented Interfaces:
StackInfoSender
public class HttpPostStackInfoSender
extends java.lang.Object
implements StackInfoSender

A StackInfoSender that performs an individual http POST to a URL for each stack info provided. The http requests will be performed inside of a single AsyncTask, so submitStackInfos must be called from the main thread. The data sent is identical to the data sent in the original android-remote-stacktrace:

  • package_name
  • package_version
  • phone_model
  • android_version
  • stacktrace

Constructor Summary
HttpPostStackInfoSender(java.lang.String postUrl)
          Construct a new HttpPostStackInfoSender that will submit stack traces by POSTing them to postUrl.

Method Detail

submitStackInfos

public void submitStackInfos(java.util.Collection<StackInfo> stackInfos,
                             java.lang.String packageName)
Description copied from interface: StackInfoSender
This method will be called during application startup if there are crash reports saved to phone memory from a previous application run. It is called on the same thread that ExceptionHandler.register is called from.

android-remote-stacktrace clears the crash reports from the device once it calls this method, so it won't be called multiple times for the same crash.

Specified by:
submitStackInfos in interface StackInfoSender
Parameters:
stackInfos - Each StackInfo represents a single crash event that has been previously saved.
packageName - The application package name, if your application wants to save it with the stacktraces.
